trans-unit.source: These release notes summarize changes from previous releases and known issues.
trans-unit.target: These release notes summarize changes from previous releases and known issues.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] We want to hear from our customers and focus on fixing problems that affect you.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] We want to hear from our customers and focus on fixing problems that affect you.

trans-unit.source: To report a problem or ask questions, please post in the [Azure Media Services MSDN Forum].
trans-unit.target: To report a problem or ask questions, please post in the [Azure Media Services MSDN Forum].

trans-unit.source: Currently Known Issues

trans-unit.source: Media Services General Issues
trans-unit.target: Media Services General Issues

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Several common HTTP headers are not provided in the REST API.
trans-unit.target: Several common HTTP headers are not provided in the REST API.

trans-unit.source: If you develop Media Services applications using the REST API, you find that some common HTTP header fields (including CLIENT-REQUEST-ID, REQUEST-ID, and RETURN-CLIENT-REQUEST-ID) are not supported.
trans-unit.target: If you develop Media Services applications using the REST API, you find that some common HTTP header fields (including CLIENT-REQUEST-ID, REQUEST-ID, and RETURN-CLIENT-REQUEST-ID) are not supported.

trans-unit.source: The headers will be added in a future update.
trans-unit.target: The headers will be added in a future update.

trans-unit.source: Encoding an asset with a file name that contains escape characters (for example, %20) fails with “MediaProcessor : File not found.”
trans-unit.target: Encoding an asset with a file name that contains escape characters (for example, %20) fails with “MediaProcessor : File not found.”

trans-unit.source: Names of files that are going to be added to an asset and then encoded should only contain alphanumeric characters and spaces.
trans-unit.target: Names of files that are going to be added to an asset and then encoded should only contain alphanumeric characters and spaces.

trans-unit.source: The issue will be fixed in a future update.
trans-unit.target: The issue will be fixed in a future update.

trans-unit.source: The ListBlobs method that is part of the Azure Storage SDK version 3.x fails.
trans-unit.target: The ListBlobs method that is part of the Azure Storage SDK version 3.x fails.

trans-unit.source: Media Services generates SAS URLs based on the [2012-02-12](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn592123.aspx) version.
trans-unit.target: Media Services generates SAS URLs based on the [2012-02-12](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn592123.aspx) version.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use Azure Storage SDK to list blobs in a blob container, use the [CloudBlobContainer.ListBlobs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.storage.blob.cloudblobcontainer.listblobs.aspx) method that is part of Azure Storage SDK version 2.x.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use Azure Storage SDK to list blobs in a blob container, use the [CloudBlobContainer.ListBlobs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/microsoft.windowsazure.storage.blob.cloudblobcontainer.listblobs.aspx) method that is part of Azure Storage SDK version 2.x.

trans-unit.source: The ListBlobs method that is part of the Azure Storage SDK version 3.x will fail.
trans-unit.target: The ListBlobs method that is part of the Azure Storage SDK version 3.x will fail.

trans-unit.source: Media Services throttling mechanism restricts the resource usage for applications that make excessive request to the service.
trans-unit.target: Media Services throttling mechanism restricts the resource usage for applications that make excessive request to the service.

trans-unit.source: The service may return the Service Unavailable (503) HTTP status code.
trans-unit.target: The service may return the Service Unavailable (503) HTTP status code.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the description of the 503 HTTP status code in the [Azure Media Services Error Codes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn168949.aspx) topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the description of the 503 HTTP status code in the [Azure Media Services Error Codes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn168949.aspx) topic.

trans-unit.source: Media Services SDK for .NET Issues
trans-unit.target: Media Services SDK for .NET Issues

trans-unit.source: Issue
trans-unit.target: Issue

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Media Services objects in the SDK cannot be serialized and as a result do not work with Azure Caching.
trans-unit.target: Media Services objects in the SDK cannot be serialized and as a result do not work with Azure Caching.

trans-unit.source: If you try to serialize the SDK AssetCollection object to add it to Azure Caching, an exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: If you try to serialize the SDK AssetCollection object to add it to Azure Caching, an exception is thrown.

trans-unit.target: For information about the Media Services REST API version history, see [Azure Media Services REST API Reference].

trans-unit.target: For more information, see:

trans-unit.source: July 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: July 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: Announcing the general availability of Media Encoder Standard.
trans-unit.target: Announcing the general availability of Media Encoder Standard.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [this blog post](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/07/16/announcing-the-general-availability-of-media-encoder-standard/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [this blog post](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/07/16/announcing-the-general-availability-of-media-encoder-standard/).

trans-unit.source: Media Encoder Standard uses presets described in [this](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=618336) section.
trans-unit.target: Media Encoder Standard uses presets described in [this](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=618336) section.

trans-unit.source: Note that when using a preset for 4k encodes, you should get the **Premium** reserved unit type.
trans-unit.target: Note that when using a preset for 4k encodes, you should get the **Premium** reserved unit type.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Scale Encoding](media-services-portal-encoding-units).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Scale Encoding](media-services-portal-encoding-units).

trans-unit.source: Live Real-time captions with Azure Media Services and Player.
trans-unit.target: Live Real-time captions with Azure Media Services and Player.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [this blog post](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/07/08/live-real-time-captions-with-azure-media-services-and-player/)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [this blog post](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/07/08/live-real-time-captions-with-azure-media-services-and-player/)

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK Updates

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.4.0.0.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.4.0.0.

trans-unit.source: The following functionality was added in this release:
trans-unit.target: The following functionality was added in this release:

trans-unit.source: Implemented support for live archive.
trans-unit.target: Implemented support for live archive.

trans-unit.source: Note that you cannot download an asset that contains a live archive.
trans-unit.target: Note that you cannot download an asset that contains a live archive.

trans-unit.source: Implemented support for dynamic filters.
trans-unit.target: Implemented support for dynamic filters.

trans-unit.source: Implemented functionality that allows users to keep storage container while deleting asset.
trans-unit.target: Implemented functionality that allows users to keep storage container while deleting asset.

trans-unit.source: Bug fixes related to retry policies in channels.
trans-unit.target: Bug fixes related to retry policies in channels.

trans-unit.source: Enabled **Media Encoder Premium Workflow**.
trans-unit.target: Enabled **Media Encoder Premium Workflow**.

trans-unit.source: June 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: June 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK Updates

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.3.0.0.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.3.0.0.

trans-unit.source: The following functionality was added in this release:
trans-unit.target: The following functionality was added in this release:

trans-unit.source: support for OpenId Connect Discovery spec,
trans-unit.target: support for OpenId Connect Discovery spec,

trans-unit.source: support for handling keys rollover on identity provider side.
trans-unit.target: support for handling keys rollover on identity provider side.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider which exposes OpenID Connect discovery document (as the following providers do: Azure Active Directory, Google, Salesforce ), you can instruct Azure Media Services to obtain signing keys for validation of JWT token from OpenID connect discovery spec.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider which exposes OpenID Connect discovery document (as the following providers do: Azure Active Directory, Google, Salesforce ), you can instruct Azure Media Services to obtain signing keys for validation of JWT token from OpenID connect discovery spec.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Using Json Web Keys from OpenID Connect discovery spec to work with JWT token authentication in Azure Media Services](http://gtrifonov.com/2015/06/07/using-json-web-keys-from-openid-connect-discovery-spec-to-work-with-jwt-token-authentication-in-azure-media-services/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using Json Web Keys from OpenID Connect discovery spec to work with JWT token authentication in Azure Media Services](http://gtrifonov.com/2015/06/07/using-json-web-keys-from-openid-connect-discovery-spec-to-work-with-jwt-token-authentication-in-azure-media-services/).

trans-unit.source: May 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: May 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: Announcing the following new features:
trans-unit.target: Announcing the following new features:

trans-unit.source: A preview of Live Encoding with Media Services
trans-unit.target: A preview of Live Encoding with Media Services

trans-unit.source: Dynamic manifest
trans-unit.target: Dynamic manifest

trans-unit.source: A preview of Azure Media Hyperlapse media processor
trans-unit.target: A preview of Azure Media Hyperlapse media processor

trans-unit.source: April 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: April 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: General Media Services Updates
trans-unit.target: General Media Services Updates

trans-unit.source: [Announcing Azure Media Player](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/04/15/announcing-azure-media-player/).
trans-unit.target: [Announcing Azure Media Player](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/04/15/announcing-azure-media-player/).

trans-unit.source: Starting with Media Services REST 2.10, channels that are configured to ingest an RTMP protocol, are created with primary and secondary ingest URLs.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Media Services REST 2.10, channels that are configured to ingest an RTMP protocol, are created with primary and secondary ingest URLs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Channel ingest configurations](media-services-manage-channels-overview.md#channel_input)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Channel ingest configurations](media-services-manage-channels-overview.md#channel_input)

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Indexer updates
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Indexer updates

trans-unit.source: Support for Spanish Language
trans-unit.target: Support for Spanish Language

trans-unit.source: New configuration xml format
trans-unit.target: New configuration xml format

trans-unit.source: For more information see [this blog](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/04/13/azure-media-indexer-spanish-v1-2/).
trans-unit.target: For more information see [this blog](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/04/13/azure-media-indexer-spanish-v1-2/).

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK Updates

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.2.0.0.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.2.0.0.

trans-unit.source: The following are some of the customer facing updates:
trans-unit.target: The following are some of the customer facing updates:

trans-unit.source: **Breaking change**: Changed **TokenRestrictionTemplate.Issuer** and **TokenRestrictionTemplate.Audience** to be of a string type.
trans-unit.target: **Breaking change**: Changed **TokenRestrictionTemplate.Issuer** and **TokenRestrictionTemplate.Audience** to be of a string type.

trans-unit.source: Updates related to creating custom retry policies.
trans-unit.target: Updates related to creating custom retry policies.

trans-unit.source: Bug fixes related to uploading/downloading files.
trans-unit.target: Bug fixes related to uploading/downloading files.

trans-unit.source: The **MediaServicesCredentials** class now accepts primary and secondary access control endpoint to authenticate against.
trans-unit.target: The **MediaServicesCredentials** class now accepts primary and secondary access control endpoint to authenticate against.

trans-unit.source: March 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: March 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: General Media Services Updates
trans-unit.target: General Media Services Updates

trans-unit.source: Media Services now provides Azure CDN integration.
trans-unit.target: Media Services now provides Azure CDN integration.

trans-unit.source: To support the integration, the **CdnEnabled** property was added to **StreamingEndpoint**.
trans-unit.target: To support the integration, the **CdnEnabled** property was added to **StreamingEndpoint**.

trans-unit.source: **CdnEnabled** can be used with REST APIs starting with version 2.9 (for more information, see [StreamingEndpoint](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783468.aspx)).
trans-unit.target: **CdnEnabled** can be used with REST APIs starting with version 2.9 (for more information, see [StreamingEndpoint](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn783468.aspx)).

trans-unit.source: **CdnEnabled** can be used with .NET SDK starting with version 3.1.0.2 (for more information, see [StreamingEndpoint](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mediaservices.client.istreamingendpoint(v=azure.10).aspx)).
trans-unit.target: **CdnEnabled** can be used with .NET SDK starting with version 3.1.0.2 (for more information, see [StreamingEndpoint](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mediaservices.client.istreamingendpoint(v=azure.10).aspx)).

trans-unit.source: Announcement of **Media Encoder Premium Workflow**.
trans-unit.target: Announcement of **Media Encoder Premium Workflow**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Introducing Premium Encoding in Azure Media Services](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/03/05/introducing-premium-encoding-in-azure-media-services).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Introducing Premium Encoding in Azure Media Services](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/03/05/introducing-premium-encoding-in-azure-media-services).

trans-unit.source: February 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: February 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: General Media Services Updates
trans-unit.target: General Media Services Updates

trans-unit.source: Media Services REST API is now version 2.9.
trans-unit.target: Media Services REST API is now version 2.9.

trans-unit.source: Starting with this version, you can enable the Azure CDN integration with streaming endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Starting with this version, you can enable the Azure CDN integration with streaming endpoints.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [StreamingEndpoint](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn783468.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [StreamingEndpoint](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn783468.aspx).

trans-unit.source: January 2015 Release
trans-unit.target: January 2015 Release

trans-unit.source: General Media Services Updates
trans-unit.target: General Media Services Updates

trans-unit.source: Announcement of General Availability (GA) of content protection with dynamic encryption.
trans-unit.target: Announcement of General Availability (GA) of content protection with dynamic encryption.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Media Services enhances streaming security with General Availability of DRM technology](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/01/29/azure-media-services-enhances-streaming-security-with-general-availability-of-drm-technology/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Media Services enhances streaming security with General Availability of DRM technology](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2015/01/29/azure-media-services-enhances-streaming-security-with-general-availability-of-drm-technology/).

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK Updates

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.1.0.1.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK is now version 3.1.0.1.

trans-unit.source: This release marked the default Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.ContentKeyAuthorization.TokenRestrictionTemplate constructor as obsolete.
trans-unit.target: This release marked the default Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.ContentKeyAuthorization.TokenRestrictionTemplate constructor as obsolete.

trans-unit.source: The new constructor takes TokenType as an argument.
trans-unit.target: The new constructor takes TokenType as an argument.

trans-unit.source: December 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: December 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: General Media Services Updates
trans-unit.target: General Media Services Updates

trans-unit.source: Some updates and new features were added to the Azure Indexer Media processor.
trans-unit.target: Some updates and new features were added to the Azure Indexer Media processor.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Media Indexer Version 1.1.6.7 Release Notes](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/12/03/azure-media-indexer-version-1-1-6-7-release-notes/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Media Indexer Version 1.1.6.7 Release Notes](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/12/03/azure-media-indexer-version-1-1-6-7-release-notes/).

trans-unit.source: Added a new REST API that enables you to update encoding reserved units: [EncodingReservedUnitType with REST](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn859236.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Added a new REST API that enables you to update encoding reserved units: [EncodingReservedUnitType with REST](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn859236.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Added CORS support for key delivery service.
trans-unit.target: Added CORS support for key delivery service.

trans-unit.source: Performance improvements of querying authorization policy options were done.
trans-unit.target: Performance improvements of querying authorization policy options were done.

trans-unit.source: In China data center, the [Key Delivery URL](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ef4dfeeb-48ae-4596-ab28-44d6b36d8769#get_delivery_service_url) is now per customer (just like in other data centers).
trans-unit.target: In China data center, the [Key Delivery URL](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ef4dfeeb-48ae-4596-ab28-44d6b36d8769#get_delivery_service_url) is now per customer (just like in other data centers).

trans-unit.source: Added HLS auto target duration.
trans-unit.target: Added HLS auto target duration.

trans-unit.source: When doing live streaming, HLS is always packaged dynamically.
trans-unit.target: When doing live streaming, HLS is always packaged dynamically.

trans-unit.source: By default, Media Services automatically calculates HLS segment packaging ratio (FragmentsPerSegment) based on the keyframe interval (KeyFrameInterval ), also referred to as Group of Pictures – GOP, that is received from the Live encoder.
trans-unit.target: By default, Media Services automatically calculates HLS segment packaging ratio (FragmentsPerSegment) based on the keyframe interval (KeyFrameInterval ), also referred to as Group of Pictures – GOP, that is received from the Live encoder.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Working with Azure Media Services Live Streaming].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Working with Azure Media Services Live Streaming].

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK Updates

trans-unit.source: [Azure Media Services .NET SDK](http://www.nuget.org/packages/windowsazure.mediaservices/) is now version 3.1.0.0.
trans-unit.target: [Azure Media Services .NET SDK](http://www.nuget.org/packages/windowsazure.mediaservices/) is now version 3.1.0.0.

trans-unit.source: Upgraded the .Net SDK dependency to .NET 4.5 Framework.
trans-unit.target: Upgraded the .Net SDK dependency to .NET 4.5 Framework.

trans-unit.source: Added a new API that enables you to update encoding reserved units.
trans-unit.target: Added a new API that enables you to update encoding reserved units.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Updating Reserved Unit Type and Increasing Encoding RUs using .NET](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj129582.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Updating Reserved Unit Type and Increasing Encoding RUs using .NET](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj129582.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Added JWT (JSON Web Token) support for token authentication.
trans-unit.target: Added JWT (JSON Web Token) support for token authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [JWT token Authentication in Azure Media Services and Dynamic Encryption](http://www.gtrifonov.com/2015/01/03/jwt-token-authentication-in-azure-media-services-and-dynamic-encryption/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [JWT token Authentication in Azure Media Services and Dynamic Encryption](http://www.gtrifonov.com/2015/01/03/jwt-token-authentication-in-azure-media-services-and-dynamic-encryption/).

trans-unit.source: Added relative offsets for BeginDate and ExpirationDate in the PlayReady license template.
trans-unit.target: Added relative offsets for BeginDate and ExpirationDate in the PlayReady license template.

trans-unit.source: November 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: November 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: Media Services now enables you to ingest a live Smooth Streaming (FMP4) content over an SSL connection.
trans-unit.target: Media Services now enables you to ingest a live Smooth Streaming (FMP4) content over an SSL connection.

trans-unit.source: To ingest over SSL, make sure to update the ingest URL to HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: To ingest over SSL, make sure to update the ingest URL to HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: For more information about live streaming, see [Working with Azure Media Services Live Streaming].
trans-unit.target: For more information about live streaming, see [Working with Azure Media Services Live Streaming].

trans-unit.source: Note that currently, you cannot ingest an RTMP live stream over an SSL connection.
trans-unit.target: Note that currently, you cannot ingest an RTMP live stream over an SSL connection.

trans-unit.source: You can also stream your content over an SSL connection.
trans-unit.target: You can also stream your content over an SSL connection.

trans-unit.source: To do this, make sure your streaming URLs start with HTTPS.
trans-unit.target: To do this, make sure your streaming URLs start with HTTPS.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can only stream over SSL if the streaming endpoint from which you deliver your content was created after September 10th, 2014.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can only stream over SSL if the streaming endpoint from which you deliver your content was created after September 10th, 2014.

trans-unit.source: If your streaming URLs are based on the streaming endpoints created after September 10th, the URL contains “streaming.mediaservices.windows.net” (the new format).
trans-unit.target: If your streaming URLs are based on the streaming endpoints created after September 10th, the URL contains “streaming.mediaservices.windows.net” (the new format).

trans-unit.source: Streaming URLs that contain “origin.mediaservices.windows.net” (the old format) do not support SSL.
trans-unit.target: Streaming URLs that contain “origin.mediaservices.windows.net” (the old format) do not support SSL.

trans-unit.source: If your URL is in the old format and you want to be able to stream over SSL, [create a new streaming endpoint](media-services-manage-origins.md).
trans-unit.target: If your URL is in the old format and you want to be able to stream over SSL, [create a new streaming endpoint](media-services-manage-origins.md).

trans-unit.source: Use URLs created based on the new streaming endpoint to stream your content over SSL.
trans-unit.target: Use URLs created based on the new streaming endpoint to stream your content over SSL.

trans-unit.source: October 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: October 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: Media Services Encoder Release
trans-unit.target: Media Services Encoder Release

trans-unit.source: Announcing the new release of Media Services Azure Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: Announcing the new release of Media Services Azure Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: With the latest Azure Media Encoder you are only charged for output GBs, but otherwise the new encoder is feature compatible with the previous encoder.
trans-unit.target: With the latest Azure Media Encoder you are only charged for output GBs, but otherwise the new encoder is feature compatible with the previous encoder.

trans-unit.source: For more information [Media Services Pricing Details]).
trans-unit.target: For more information [Media Services Pricing Details]).

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Media Services SDK for .NET Extensions is now version 2.0.0.3.
trans-unit.target: Media Services SDK for .NET Extensions is now version 2.0.0.3.

trans-unit.source: Media Services SDK for .NET is now version 3.0.0.8.
trans-unit.target: Media Services SDK for .NET is now version 3.0.0.8.

trans-unit.source: The following changes were made:
trans-unit.target: The following changes were made:

trans-unit.source: Refactoring in retry policy classes.
trans-unit.target: Refactoring in retry policy classes.

trans-unit.source: Adding user agent string to http request headers.
trans-unit.target: Adding user agent string to http request headers.

trans-unit.source: Adding nuget restore build step.
trans-unit.target: Adding nuget restore build step.

trans-unit.source: Fixing scenario tests to use x509 cert from repository.
trans-unit.target: Fixing scenario tests to use x509 cert from repository.

trans-unit.source: Validating settings when updating channel and streaming end.
trans-unit.target: Validating settings when updating channel and streaming end.

trans-unit.source: New GitHub repository to host Media Services samples
trans-unit.target: New GitHub repository to host Media Services samples

trans-unit.source: Samples are located in [Azure Media Services samples GitHub repository](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Media-Services-Samples).
trans-unit.target: Samples are located in [Azure Media Services samples GitHub repository](https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Media-Services-Samples).

trans-unit.source: September 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: September 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: Media Services REST metadata is now version 2.7.
trans-unit.target: Media Services REST metadata is now version 2.7.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the latest REST updates, see [Azure Media Services REST API Reference].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the latest REST updates, see [Azure Media Services REST API Reference].

trans-unit.source: Media Services SDK for .NET is now version 3.0.0.7
trans-unit.target: Media Services SDK for .NET is now version 3.0.0.7

trans-unit.source: Breaking Changes
trans-unit.target: Breaking Changes

trans-unit.source: **Origin** was renamed to [StreamingEndpoint].
trans-unit.target: **Origin** was renamed to [StreamingEndpoint].

trans-unit.source: A change in the default behavior when using the **Azure Management Portal** to encode and then publish MP4 files.
trans-unit.target: A change in the default behavior when using the **Azure Management Portal** to encode and then publish MP4 files.

trans-unit.source: Previously, when using the Management Portal to publish a single-file MP4 video asset a SAS URL would be created (SAS URLs allow you to download the video from a blob storage).
trans-unit.target: Previously, when using the Management Portal to publish a single-file MP4 video asset a SAS URL would be created (SAS URLs allow you to download the video from a blob storage).

trans-unit.source: Currently, when you use the Management Portal to encode and then publish a single-file MP4 video asset, the generated URL points to an Azure Media Services streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Currently, when you use the Management Portal to encode and then publish a single-file MP4 video asset, the generated URL points to an Azure Media Services streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This change does not affect MP4 videos that are directly uploaded to Media Services and published without being encoded by Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: This change does not affect MP4 videos that are directly uploaded to Media Services and published without being encoded by Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Currently, you have the following two options to solve the problem.
trans-unit.target: Currently, you have the following two options to solve the problem.

trans-unit.source: Enable streaming units and use dynamic packaging to stream the .mp4 asset as a smooth streaming presentation.
trans-unit.target: Enable streaming units and use dynamic packaging to stream the .mp4 asset as a smooth streaming presentation.

trans-unit.source: Create a SAS url to download (or progressively play) the .mp4.
trans-unit.target: Create a SAS url to download (or progressively play) the .mp4.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to create a SAS locator, see [Delivering Content].
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to create a SAS locator, see [Delivering Content].

trans-unit.source: New features\scenarios that are part of GA release
trans-unit.target: New features\scenarios that are part of GA release

trans-unit.source: **Indexer Media Processor**.
trans-unit.target: **Indexer Media Processor**.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer].
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Indexing Media Files with Azure Media Indexer].

trans-unit.source: The [StreamingEndpoint] entity now enables you to add custom domain (host) names.
trans-unit.target: The [StreamingEndpoint] entity now enables you to add custom domain (host) names.

trans-unit.source: For a custom domain name to be used as the Media Services streaming endpoint name, you need to add custom host names to your streaming endpoint.
trans-unit.target: For a custom domain name to be used as the Media Services streaming endpoint name, you need to add custom host names to your streaming endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Use the Media Services REST APIs or .NET SDK to add custom host names.
trans-unit.target: Use the Media Services REST APIs or .NET SDK to add custom host names.

trans-unit.source: The following considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: The following considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: You must have the ownership of the custom domain name.
trans-unit.target: You must have the ownership of the custom domain name.

trans-unit.source: The ownership of the domain name must be validated by Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: The ownership of the domain name must be validated by Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: To validate the domain, create a CName that maps
trans-unit.target: To validate the domain, create a CName that maps

trans-unit.source: to verifydns.<mediaservices-dns-zone>.
trans-unit.target: to verifydns.<mediaservices-dns-zone>.

trans-unit.source: You must create another CName that maps the custom host name (for example, sports.contoso.com) to your Media Services StreamingEndpont’s host name (for example, amstest.streaming.mediaservices.windows.net).
trans-unit.target: You must create another CName that maps the custom host name (for example, sports.contoso.com) to your Media Services StreamingEndpont’s host name (for example, amstest.streaming.mediaservices.windows.net).

trans-unit.source: New features\scenarios that are part of the public preview release
trans-unit.target: New features\scenarios that are part of the public preview release

trans-unit.target: Live Streaming Preview.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Working with Azure Media Services Live Streaming].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Working with Azure Media Services Live Streaming].

trans-unit.target: Key Delivery Service.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service].

trans-unit.target: AES Dynamic Encryption.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Using AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using AES-128 Dynamic Encryption and Key Delivery Service].

trans-unit.target: PlayReady License Delivery Service.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using PlayReady Dynamic Encryption and License Delivery Service].

trans-unit.target: PlayReady Dynamic Encryption.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Using PlayReady Dynamic Encryption and License Delivery Service].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Using PlayReady Dynamic Encryption and License Delivery Service].

trans-unit.target: Media Services PlayReady License Template.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Media Services PlayReady License Template Overview].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Media Services PlayReady License Template Overview].

trans-unit.target: Streaming storage encrypted assets.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Streaming Storage Encrypted Content].

trans-unit.source: August 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: August 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: When you encode an asset, an output asset is produced upon completion of the encoding job.
trans-unit.target: When you encode an asset, an output asset is produced upon completion of the encoding job.

trans-unit.source: Until this release, Azure Media Services Encoder produced metadata about output assets.
trans-unit.target: Until this release, Azure Media Services Encoder produced metadata about output assets.

trans-unit.source: Starting with this release the encoder also produces metadata about input assets.
trans-unit.target: Starting with this release the encoder also produces metadata about input assets.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Input Metadata] and [Output Metadata] topics.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Input Metadata] and [Output Metadata] topics.

trans-unit.source: July 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: July 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: The following bug fixes were made for the Azure Media Services Packager and Encryptor:
trans-unit.target: The following bug fixes were made for the Azure Media Services Packager and Encryptor:

trans-unit.source: Only audio plays back when transmuxing a live archive asset to HTTP Live Streaming – this has been fixed and now both audio and video are played.
trans-unit.target: Only audio plays back when transmuxing a live archive asset to HTTP Live Streaming – this has been fixed and now both audio and video are played.

trans-unit.source: When packaging an asset to HTTP Live Streaming and AES 128-bit envelope encryption, the packaged streams do not play back on Android devices – this bug has been fixed and the packaged stream plays back on Android devices that support HTTP Live Streaming.
trans-unit.target: When packaging an asset to HTTP Live Streaming and AES 128-bit envelope encryption, the packaged streams do not play back on Android devices – this bug has been fixed and the packaged stream plays back on Android devices that support HTTP Live Streaming.

trans-unit.source: May 2014 Release
trans-unit.target: May 2014 Release

trans-unit.source: General Media Services Updates
trans-unit.target: General Media Services Updates

trans-unit.source: You can now use [Dynamic Packaging] to stream HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) v3.
trans-unit.target: You can now use [Dynamic Packaging] to stream HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) v3.

trans-unit.source: To stream HLS v3, add the following format to the origin locator path: * .ism/manifest(format=m3u8-aapl-v3).
trans-unit.target: To stream HLS v3, add the following format to the origin locator path: * .ism/manifest(format=m3u8-aapl-v3).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Nick Drouin's Blog].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Nick Drouin's Blog].

trans-unit.source: Dynamic Packaging now also supports delivering HLS (v3 and v4) encrypted with PlayReady based on Smooth Streaming statically encrypted with PlayReady.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic Packaging now also supports delivering HLS (v3 and v4) encrypted with PlayReady based on Smooth Streaming statically encrypted with PlayReady.

trans-unit.source: For information on how to encrypt Smooth Streaming with PlayReady, see [Protecting Smooth Stream with PlayReady].
trans-unit.target: For information on how to encrypt Smooth Streaming with PlayReady, see [Protecting Smooth Stream with PlayReady].

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK Updates

trans-unit.source: The following improvements are included in the Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.5 release:
trans-unit.target: The following improvements are included in the Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.5 release:

trans-unit.source: Better speed and resilience for uploading/downloading media assets.
trans-unit.target: Better speed and resilience for uploading/downloading media assets.

trans-unit.source: Improvements in retry logic and transient exception handling:
trans-unit.target: Improvements in retry logic and transient exception handling:

trans-unit.source: Transient error detection and retry logic were improved for exceptions that are caused by querying, saving changes, uploading or downloading files.
trans-unit.target: Transient error detection and retry logic were improved for exceptions that are caused by querying, saving changes, uploading or downloading files.

trans-unit.source: When getting Web Exceptions (for example, during an ACS token request), you will notice that fatal errors are failing faster now.
trans-unit.target: When getting Web Exceptions (for example, during an ACS token request), you will notice that fatal errors are failing faster now.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Retry Logic in the Media Services SDK for .NET].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Retry Logic in the Media Services SDK for .NET].

trans-unit.source: April 2014 Encoder Release
trans-unit.target: April 2014 Encoder Release

trans-unit.source: Media Services Encoder Updates
trans-unit.target: Media Services Encoder Updates

trans-unit.source: Added support for ingesting AVI files authored using the Grass Valley EDIUS nonlinear editor, where the video is lightly compressed using Grass Valley HQ/HQX codec.
trans-unit.target: Added support for ingesting AVI files authored using the Grass Valley EDIUS nonlinear editor, where the video is lightly compressed using Grass Valley HQ/HQX codec.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Grass Valley Announces EDIUS 7 Streaming Through the Cloud].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Grass Valley Announces EDIUS 7 Streaming Through the Cloud].

trans-unit.source: Added support for specifying the naming convention for the files produced by the Media Encoder.
trans-unit.target: Added support for specifying the naming convention for the files produced by the Media Encoder.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Controlling Media Service Encoder Output Filenames].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Controlling Media Service Encoder Output Filenames].

trans-unit.source: Added support for video and/or audio overlays.
trans-unit.target: Added support for video and/or audio overlays.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Creating Overlays].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Creating Overlays].

trans-unit.source: Added support for stitching together multiple video segments.
trans-unit.target: Added support for stitching together multiple video segments.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Stitching Video Segments].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Stitching Video Segments].

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug related to transcoding of MP4s where the audio has been encoded with MPEG-1 Audio layer 3 (aka MP3).
trans-unit.target: Fixed a bug related to transcoding of MP4s where the audio has been encoded with MPEG-1 Audio layer 3 (aka MP3).

trans-unit.source: January\February 2014 Releases
trans-unit.target: January\February 2014 Releases

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.1, 3.0.0.2 and 3.0.0.3
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.1, 3.0.0.2 and 3.0.0.3

trans-unit.source: The changes in 3.0.0.1 and 3.0.0.2 include:
trans-unit.target: The changes in 3.0.0.1 and 3.0.0.2 include:

trans-unit.source: Fixed issues related to usage of LINQ queries with OrderBy statements.
trans-unit.target: Fixed issues related to usage of LINQ queries with OrderBy statements.

trans-unit.source: Split test solutions in [GitHub] into Unit-based tests and Scenario-based tests.
trans-unit.target: Split test solutions in [GitHub] into Unit-based tests and Scenario-based tests.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the changes, see: [Azure Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.1 and 3.0.0.2 releases].
trans-unit.target: For more details about the changes, see: [Azure Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.1 and 3.0.0.2 releases].

trans-unit.source: The following changes were made in 3.0.0.3:
trans-unit.target: The following changes were made in 3.0.0.3:

trans-unit.source: Upgraded Azure storage dependencies to use version 3.0.3.0.
trans-unit.target: Upgraded Azure storage dependencies to use version 3.0.3.0.

trans-unit.source: releases.
trans-unit.target: releases.

trans-unit.source: December 2013 Release
trans-unit.target: December 2013 Release

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.0
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK 3.0.0.0

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] 3.0.x.x releases are not backward compatible with 2.4.x.x releases.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] 3.0.x.x releases are not backward compatible with 2.4.x.x releases.

trans-unit.source: The latest version of the Media Services SDK is now 3.0.0.0.
trans-unit.target: The latest version of the Media Services SDK is now 3.0.0.0.

trans-unit.source: You can download the latest package from Nuget or get the bits from [GitHub].
trans-unit.target: You can download the latest package from Nuget or get the bits from [GitHub].

trans-unit.source: Starting with the Media Services SDK version 3.0.0.0, you can reuse the [Azure Active Directory Access Control Service (ACS)] tokens.
trans-unit.target: Starting with the Media Services SDK version 3.0.0.0, you can reuse the [Azure Active Directory Access Control Service (ACS)] tokens.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the “Reusing Access Control Service Tokens” section in the [Connecting to Media Services with the Media Services SDK for .NET] topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the “Reusing Access Control Service Tokens” section in the [Connecting to Media Services with the Media Services SDK for .NET] topic.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions 2.0.0.0
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions 2.0.0.0

trans-unit.source: The Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions is a set of extension methods and helper functions that will simplify your code and make it easier to develop with Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions is a set of extension methods and helper functions that will simplify your code and make it easier to develop with Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: You can get the latest bits from [Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions].
trans-unit.target: You can get the latest bits from [Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions].

trans-unit.source: November 2013 Release
trans-unit.target: November 2013 Release

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK Changes
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK Changes

trans-unit.source: Starting with this version, the Media Services SDK for .NET handles transient fault errors that may occur when making calls to the Media Services REST API layer.
trans-unit.target: Starting with this version, the Media Services SDK for .NET handles transient fault errors that may occur when making calls to the Media Services REST API layer.

trans-unit.source: August 2013 Release
trans-unit.target: August 2013 Release

trans-unit.source: Media Services PowerShell Cmdlets included in Azure Sdk Tools
trans-unit.target: Media Services PowerShell Cmdlets included in Azure Sdk Tools

trans-unit.source: The following Media Services PowerShell cmdlets are now included in [azure-sdk-tools].
trans-unit.target: The following Media Services PowerShell cmdlets are now included in [azure-sdk-tools].

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureMediaServices
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureMediaServices

trans-unit.source: For example, `Get-AzureMediaServicesAccount`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `Get-AzureMediaServicesAccount`.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureMediaServicesAccount
trans-unit.target: New-AzureMediaServicesAccount

trans-unit.source: For example, `New-AzureMediaServicesAccount -Name “MediaAccountName” -Location “Region” -StorageAccountName “StorageAccountName”`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `New-AzureMediaServicesAccount -Name “MediaAccountName” -Location “Region” -StorageAccountName “StorageAccountName”`.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureMediaServicesKey
trans-unit.target: New-AzureMediaServicesKey

trans-unit.source: For example, `New-AzureMediaServicesKey -Name “MediaAccountName” -KeyType Secondary -Force`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `New-AzureMediaServicesKey -Name “MediaAccountName” -KeyType Secondary -Force`.

trans-unit.source: Remove-AzureMediaServicesAccount
trans-unit.target: Remove-AzureMediaServicesAccount

trans-unit.source: For example, `Remove-AzureMediaServicesAccount -Name “MediaAccountName” -Force`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `Remove-AzureMediaServicesAccount -Name “MediaAccountName” -Force`.

trans-unit.source: June 2013 Release
trans-unit.target: June 2013 Release

trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services changes

trans-unit.target: The changes mentioned in this section are updates included in the June 2013 Media Services releases.

trans-unit.target: Ability to update Job.Priority.

trans-unit.target: JobNotificationSubscription

trans-unit.target: NotificationEndPoint

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK changes
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK changes

trans-unit.source: The following changes are included in June 2013 Media Services SDK releases.
trans-unit.target: The following changes are included in June 2013 Media Services SDK releases.

trans-unit.source: The latest Media Services SDK is available on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: The latest Media Services SDK is available on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Starting with the version 2.3.0.0, the Media Services SDK supports linking multiple storage accounts to a Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Starting with the version 2.3.0.0, the Media Services SDK supports linking multiple storage accounts to a Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: The following APIs support this feature:
trans-unit.target: The following APIs support this feature:

trans-unit.source: The IStorageAccount type.
trans-unit.target: The IStorageAccount type.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.CloudMediaContext.StorageAccounts property.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.CloudMediaContext.StorageAccounts property.

trans-unit.source: The StorageAccount property.
trans-unit.target: The StorageAccount property.

trans-unit.source: The StorageAccountName property.
trans-unit.target: The StorageAccountName property.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Managing Media Services Assets across Multiple Storage Accounts].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Managing Media Services Assets across Multiple Storage Accounts].

trans-unit.source: Notification related APIs.
trans-unit.target: Notification related APIs.

trans-unit.source: Starting with the version 2.2.0.0 you have the ability to listen to Azure Queue storage notifications.
trans-unit.target: Starting with the version 2.2.0.0 you have the ability to listen to Azure Queue storage notifications.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, [Handling Media Services Job Notifications].
trans-unit.target: For more information see, [Handling Media Services Job Notifications].

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.IJob.JobNotificationSubscriptions property.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.IJob.JobNotificationSubscriptions property.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.INotificationEndPoint type.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.INotificationEndPoint type.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.IJobNotificationSubscription type.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.IJobNotificationSubscription type.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.NotificationEndPointCollection type.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.NotificationEndPointCollection type.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.NotificationEndPointType type.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.NotificationEndPointType type.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.NotificationJobState type.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MediaServices.Client.NotificationJobState type.

trans-unit.source: Dependency on the Azure Storage Client SDK 2.0 (Microsoft.WindowsAzure.StorageClient.dll).
trans-unit.target: Dependency on the Azure Storage Client SDK 2.0 (Microsoft.WindowsAzure.StorageClient.dll).

trans-unit.source: Dependency on OData 5.5 (Microsoft.Data.OData.dll).
trans-unit.target: Dependency on OData 5.5 (Microsoft.Data.OData.dll).

trans-unit.source: December 2012 Release
trans-unit.target: December 2012 Release

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services .NET SDK changes
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services .NET SDK changes

trans-unit.source: Intellisense : Added missing Intellisense documentation for many types.
trans-unit.target: Intellisense : Added missing Intellisense documentation for many types.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Practices.TransientFaultHandling.Core : Fixed an issue where the SDK still had a dependency to an old version of this assembly.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Practices.TransientFaultHandling.Core : Fixed an issue where the SDK still had a dependency to an old version of this assembly.

trans-unit.source: The SDK now references version 5.1.1209.1 of this assembly.
trans-unit.target: The SDK now references version 5.1.1209.1 of this assembly.

trans-unit.source: Fixes for issues found in the November 2012 SDK:
trans-unit.target: Fixes for issues found in the November 2012 SDK:

trans-unit.source: IAsset.Locators.Count : This count is now correctly reported on new IAsset interfaces after all locators have been deleted.
trans-unit.target: IAsset.Locators.Count : This count is now correctly reported on new IAsset interfaces after all locators have been deleted.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.ContentFileSize : This value is now properly set after an upload by IAssetFile.Upload(filepath).
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.ContentFileSize : This value is now properly set after an upload by IAssetFile.Upload(filepath).

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.ContentFileSize : This property can now be set when creating an asset file.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.ContentFileSize : This property can now be set when creating an asset file.

trans-unit.source: It was previously read-only.
trans-unit.target: It was previously read-only.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.Upload(filepath) : Fixed an issue where this synchronous upload method was throwing the following error when uploading multiple files to the asset.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.Upload(filepath) : Fixed an issue where this synchronous upload method was throwing the following error when uploading multiple files to the asset.

trans-unit.source: The error was "Server failed to authenticate the request.
trans-unit.target: The error was "Server failed to authenticate the request.

trans-unit.source: Make sure the value of Authorization header is formed correctly including the signature."
trans-unit.target: Make sure the value of Authorization header is formed correctly including the signature."

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.UploadAsync : Fixed an issue where no more than 5 files could be uploaded simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.UploadAsync : Fixed an issue where no more than 5 files could be uploaded simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.UploadProgressChanged : This event is now provided by the SDK.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.UploadProgressChanged : This event is now provided by the SDK.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.DownloadAsync(string, BlobTransferClient, ILocator, CancellationToken): This method overload is now provided.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.DownloadAsync(string, BlobTransferClient, ILocator, CancellationToken): This method overload is now provided.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.DownloadAsync : Fixed an issue where no more than 5 files could be downloaded simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.DownloadAsync : Fixed an issue where no more than 5 files could be downloaded simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.Delete() : Fixed an issue where calling delete may throw an exception if no file was uploaded for the IAssetFile.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.Delete() : Fixed an issue where calling delete may throw an exception if no file was uploaded for the IAssetFile.

trans-unit.source: Jobs : Fixed an issue where chaining a "MP4 to Smooth Streams task" with a "PlayReady Protection Task" using a job template would not create any tasks at all.
trans-unit.target: Jobs : Fixed an issue where chaining a "MP4 to Smooth Streams task" with a "PlayReady Protection Task" using a job template would not create any tasks at all.

trans-unit.source: EncryptionUtils.GetCertificateFromStore() : This method no longer throws a null reference exception due to a failures finding the certificate based on certificate configuration issues.
trans-unit.target: EncryptionUtils.GetCertificateFromStore() : This method no longer throws a null reference exception due to a failures finding the certificate based on certificate configuration issues.

trans-unit.source: November 2012 Release
trans-unit.target: November 2012 Release

trans-unit.source: The changes mentioned in this section were updates included in the November 2012 (version 2.0.0.0) SDK.
trans-unit.target: The changes mentioned in this section were updates included in the November 2012 (version 2.0.0.0) SDK.

trans-unit.source: These changes may require any code written for the June 2012 preview SDK release to be modified or rewritten.
trans-unit.target: These changes may require any code written for the June 2012 preview SDK release to be modified or rewritten.

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: IAsset.Create(assetName) is the ONLY asset creation function.
trans-unit.target: IAsset.Create(assetName) is the ONLY asset creation function.

trans-unit.source: IAsset.Create no longer uploads files as part of the method call.
trans-unit.target: IAsset.Create no longer uploads files as part of the method call.

trans-unit.source: Use IAssetFile for uploading.
trans-unit.target: Use IAssetFile for uploading.

trans-unit.source: The IAsset.Publish method and the AssetState.Publish enumeration value have been removed from the Services SDK.
trans-unit.target: The IAsset.Publish method and the AssetState.Publish enumeration value have been removed from the Services SDK.

trans-unit.source: Any code that relies on this value must be re-written.
trans-unit.target: Any code that relies on this value must be re-written.

trans-unit.source: FileInfo
trans-unit.target: FileInfo

trans-unit.source: This class has been removed and replaced by IAssetFile.
trans-unit.target: This class has been removed and replaced by IAssetFile.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFiles
trans-unit.target: IAssetFiles

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile replaces FileInfo and has a different behavior.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile replaces FileInfo and has a different behavior.

trans-unit.source: To use it, instantiate the IAssetFiles object, followed by a file upload either using the Media Services SDK or the Azure Storage SDK.
trans-unit.target: To use it, instantiate the IAssetFiles object, followed by a file upload either using the Media Services SDK or the Azure Storage SDK.

trans-unit.source: The following IAssetFile.Upload overloads can be used:
trans-unit.target: The following IAssetFile.Upload overloads can be used:

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.Upload(filePath): A synchronous method that blocks the thread and is recommended only when uploading a single file.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.Upload(filePath): A synchronous method that blocks the thread and is recommended only when uploading a single file.

trans-unit.source: IAssetFile.UploadAsync(filePath, blobTransferClient, locator, cancellationToken): An asynchronous method.
trans-unit.target: IAssetFile.UploadAsync(filePath, blobTransferClient, locator, cancellationToken): An asynchronous method.

trans-unit.source: This is the preferred upload mechanism.
trans-unit.target: This is the preferred upload mechanism.

trans-unit.source: Known bug: using the cancellationToken will indeed cancel the upload; however, the cancellation state of the tasks can be any of a number of states.
trans-unit.target: Known bug: using the cancellationToken will indeed cancel the upload; however, the cancellation state of the tasks can be any of a number of states.

trans-unit.source: You must properly catch and handle exceptions.
trans-unit.target: You must properly catch and handle exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Locators
trans-unit.target: Locators

trans-unit.source: The Origin-specific versions have been removed.
trans-unit.target: The Origin-specific versions have been removed.

trans-unit.source: The SAS-specific context.Locators.CreateSasLocator(asset, accessPolicy) will be marked deprecated, or removed by GA.
trans-unit.target: The SAS-specific context.Locators.CreateSasLocator(asset, accessPolicy) will be marked deprecated, or removed by GA.

trans-unit.source: See the Locators section under New Functionality for updated behavior.
trans-unit.target: See the Locators section under New Functionality for updated behavior.

trans-unit.source: June 2012 Preview Release
trans-unit.target: June 2012 Preview Release

trans-unit.source: The following functionality was new in the November release of the SDK.
trans-unit.target: The following functionality was new in the November release of the SDK.

trans-unit.source: Deleting Entities
trans-unit.target: Deleting Entities

trans-unit.source: IAsset, IAssetFile, ILocator, IAccessPolicy, IContentKey objects are now deleted at the object level, i.e. IObject.Delete(), instead of requiring a delete in the Collection, that is cloudMediaContext.ObjCollection.Delete(objInstance).
trans-unit.target: IAsset, IAssetFile, ILocator, IAccessPolicy, IContentKey objects are now deleted at the object level, i.e. IObject.Delete(), instead of requiring a delete in the Collection, that is cloudMediaContext.ObjCollection.Delete(objInstance).

trans-unit.source: Locators
trans-unit.target: Locators

trans-unit.source: Locators must now be created using the CreateLocator method and use the LocatorType.SAS or LocatorType.OnDemandOrigin enum values as an argument for the specific type of locator you want to create.
trans-unit.target: Locators must now be created using the CreateLocator method and use the LocatorType.SAS or LocatorType.OnDemandOrigin enum values as an argument for the specific type of locator you want to create.

trans-unit.source: New properties were added to Locators to make it easier to obtain usable URIs for your content.
trans-unit.target: New properties were added to Locators to make it easier to obtain usable URIs for your content.

trans-unit.source: This redesign of Locators was meant to provide more flexibility for future third-party extensibility and increase ease-of-use for media client applications.
trans-unit.target: This redesign of Locators was meant to provide more flexibility for future third-party extensibility and increase ease-of-use for media client applications.

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous Method Support
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous Method Support

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous support has been added to all methods.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous support has been added to all methods.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
